titles.title: Having seen the world’s fair beauty

properties.verseOrder: v1 c1 v2 c1 v3 c1 v4 c1 v5 c1

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Having seen the world’s fair beauty, Lord, I would be blind once more, Lest I lose the loving Presence And Delight I knew before.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v1
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Having seen the world’s fair beauty, Lord, I would be blind once more, Lest I lose the loving Presence And Delight I knew before.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Dawn and sunset, star and moonlight, I can see in paradise, But while here on earth His mercy For my blindness will suffice.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: {lang-eng}I no more would be delivered From my thorn, but look for grace, While within the veil His glory Shineth brightly on my face.{/lang-eng}

verse.name: v4
v5
verse.lines: {lang-eng}Sun and moonlight far surpassing, Clouds and Milky Way o’erspread, Is the glory all transcending Shining from His thorn-crowned head.{/lang-eng}
